question: What is the punishment for Wearing the dress or carrying any token used by a soldier, sailor or airman with intent that it may be believed that he is such a soldier, sailor or airman?
answer: 3 Months or Fine or Both (Section: IPC_140)

fine_tunned_model_answers:
The punishment for wearing the dress or carrying any token used by a soldier, sailor, or airman with intent that it may be believed that he is such a soldier, sailor, or airman is as follows:

Under the Prevention of Insult to Military Warrant and Badges Act, 1974, Section 11 states:

“Whoever, with intent that any person shall believe him to be a soldier, sailor or airman, wears or carries any token or device used by such a soldier, sailor or airman, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.”

Section 125 of the Indian Penal Code states "Punishment for receiving property taken by war or depredation":

"Whoever, in consequence of receiving or possessing any property taken by war or depredation, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both."

Section 126 of the IPC further clarifies the definition of "property taken by war or depredation":

"Property taken by war or depredation.— 'Property taken by war or depredation' means property which has been taken or obtained, whether directly or indirectly, from any person in consequence of any act of war or depredation, including any act of violence or intimidation, committed by any person, or by any public or private person or authority acting in pursuance of any such act, and including any property which has been so taken or obtained in any of the following modes—

Firstly. By force or violence; or

Secondly. By fraud or false pretences; or

Thirdly. By misrepresentation; or
